history.content:
For F19, there were hiring constraints for C8 that will prevent enrollment from expanding past the current total of 1320. So, if you are not within the 10% range (we estimate that number of enrolled students will drop any given class), then you probably want to make alternate plans.

Even if you do fall within that 10% range, you should still have a good back up plan because there are no guarantees for wait listed students.

children.subject:
I wish I could offer you all more hope. There is always a slim chance that the situation could change but in my last conversation with faculty they sounded pretty firm on not expanding past the current enrollment capacity. As the CS Enrollment Manager, I am usually the one to announce these things to wait listed students but I've been away for 2 weeks so consider this Piazza post the announcement. 

Much as we try to accommodate demand, we simply do not have infinite space/budget/teaching resources. Although it's disappointing news, the kindest advice I can offer right now to ALL wait listed students is to develop a back up plan. Being wait listed (even within the 10% attrition range) does NOT guarantee that you will get into the class. The higher your wait list position, the more I encourage you to consider taking an alternate class in F19 and trying again to enroll for Data 8 in SP20 semester. 

If you choose to remain on the wait list, you are welcome to do so. But be prepared to be patient and attend the class even if you are wait listed until the add/drop deadline on September 18th.

Hi Cindy,

Is there any chance at all that the situation will change and the class will get expanded? When was the faculty planning on announcing this to everyone on the waitlist?

Thank you

history.content:
Hello, I am a student thinking of taking CS C8 this upcoming fall - but have done so a little late where I am in the 258th waitlist position.

Though I am thinking of giving up and enrolling in some other class this semester, I have heard the information that "it is common for big cs classes to not open up all of the seats for enrollment yet due to making sure they have money/GSIs to teach sections". 

So I was wondering if there are any chances left for me to enroll in that course? (Context: 1284/ 1350 enrolled, 258/305 on the waitlist )

Thank you!
history.subject: CS C 8 waitlist
